original: Larson, Per Olof, ingenjör, Linköping, f. 2/6/01 i Sy a, östergötl. 1., av Per Otto o. Erika L. G. 37 m. Margareta Olsson. Barn: Karin f. 40, Bo 42. — Utex. fr. Norrköp. tekn. elem:-skolas mek. linje 22, spec :stud.’v. Ar-mour Inst. of Techn., Sterling-Morton Highschol samt Northwestern Univ. i Chicago, USA, 26-30. Anst. v. olika mek. verkstäder i Chicago 24-26, v. Western Electric Co. arbetsstudie- o. planer :avd., Chicago-Baltimore, 26-32, A-B Bofors metallurg. avd. (rationali-ser.) 36-36, verkst :ing. v. A-B Arboga Mek. Verkst. 36-40, planer :ing. v. A-B Sv. Järnv |verkstäderna i Linköp. 40-46, verkst :ch. å vissa avd. där sed. 46. Stud:resa t. USA 46.
translated: Larson, Per Olof, engineer, Linköping, b. 2/6/01 in Sya, Östergötland, 1st child of Per Otto and Erika L. G., married to Margareta Olsson in 1937. Children: Karin b. 1940, Bo b. 1942. — Graduated from Norrköping Technical Elementary School with a mechanical line in 1922, specialized studies at Armour Institute of Technology, Sterling-Morton High School, and Northwestern University in Chicago, USA, 1926-1930. Employed at various mechanical workshops in Chicago from 1924 to 1926, at Western Electric Co. in the work study and planning department in Chicago-Baltimore from 1926 to 1932, at A-B Bofors in the metallurgical department (rationalization) from 1936 to 1936, as a mechanical engineer at A-B Arboga Mekaniska Verkstad from 1936 to 1940, as a planning engineer at A-B Swedish Ironworks in Linköping from 1940 to 1946, and as the head of certain departments there since 1946. Made a study trip to the US in 1946.
